751f31e2-f3c8-437c-88fa-5ac8c712d9d7.description: Earners of the Data Analytics Boot Camp certification have demonstrated a range of fundamental data analytics skills. They are competent in Excel; Python and associated data tools such as Pandas and Matplotlib; SQL and MongoDB databases; web visualisation using HTML, CSS and JavaScript; and machine learning techniques and algorithms. They have worked individually and in teams to develop and test a portfolio of web-based data visualisation applications.
751f31e2-f3c8-437c-88fa-5ac8c712d9d7.name: Data Analytics

badge_template_activities.title: Work in a group to collate, clean and format data on a chosen topic, then create and present effective visualisations of that data. Demonstrates the use of Git for collaboration, APIs and Pandas to source, clean and format datasets, and Matplotlib to create compelling visualisations of their data.  Groups also prepare a detailed report on the work processes, challenges and solutions of their project.

Use machine learning to visualise and analyse data on a chosen issue or problem, glean and effectively present valuable information on that issue, and suggest solutions. Write a technical report on the processes performed.  Demonstrates ETL methodology on multiple real datasets,  data pre-processing techniques and algorithms including logistic regression, SVM, KNN, decision trees, and random forests and the creation of a web-based data visualisation dashboard application.

Work in a group to tell a story through data in an interactive and visually compelling way, focusing on providing an interactive means to explore data. Demonstrates the use of Python Flask application (API, HTML/CSS, JavaScript) powered by a large dataset, driven by user-focused interactions and a visualisation providing multiple views to present their findings in a variety of ways. Groups also prepare a presentation detailing a data deep-dive and infrastructure walkthrough.

e0a945d0-a888-4241-85b6-c64b6be4b81c.description: Earners of the Cybersecurity Boot camp certification have demonstrated methods, techniques, and best practices for assessing and conveying the severity of the risks facing an organisation’s security posture and developing strategies to mitigate those risks. Earners are experienced in using tools such as Wireshark, Kali Linux, Metasploit and Nessus. Earners have worked individually and in teams to complete and present three projects on networking and modern information security.
e0a945d0-a888-4241-85b6-c64b6be4b81c.name: Cybersecurity

badge_template_activities.title: Use virtualisation technologies to configure a basic network, then secure that network by implementing user, group, and password policies, configuring local and remote access controls, and scheduling regular security and maintenance tasks.

Work in teams in a scenario-based simulation of an attack on a virtual machine (VM). Students take the roles of penetration testers and security operations centre (SOC) analyst. Demonstrates the use of Kibana to analyse the attack and the interpretation of log data to suggest mitigation measures.

Work in teams to implement the alarms and thresholds determined effective in Project 2 and test the alerts by attacking the original VM and two other vulnerable VMs. Use Wireshark to analyse live malicious traffic on the wire and verify that the rules work as expected. The project culminates in a group presentation.

a6219009-430b-4043-a3ae-e19fc2da6e13.description: Earners of the Web Development Bootcamp certification have demonstrated fundamental full stack website and web application development skills. They are competent in front and back end development, including coding in JavaScript, HTML and CSS and utilising MySQL and MongoDB databases. They have worked individually and in teams to develop, test and trouble-shoot a portfolio of websites and apps.
a6219009-430b-4043-a3ae-e19fc2da6e13.name: Web Development

badge_template_activities.title: Work in a group to create a full stack application. The project and progress issues must be fully documented. Demonstrates use of HTML5/CSS, Interactivity (AJAX), JavaScript/jQuery, MySQL, State Management, Node.js, Sessions, Express.js, Bootstrap and ORM.

Design, build, test and demonstrate a final full-stack project. Demonstrates the ability to clearly define project scope, utilise responsive design practices, organise code, Quality Assurance test, and deploy a finished product on time.

aff724c6-2665-45da-b6c7-b0e95a83b271.description: Recipients of the Alumni Mentoring Network badge are verified members of the Monash alumni community and have participated as a mentee, mentor or both in 2021.
aff724c6-2665-45da-b6c7-b0e95a83b271.name: Alumni Mentoring Network 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in the Monash Alumni Mentoring network in 2021. This requires Monash alumni status and meetings completed via the mentoring platform.

9a273ba3-5092-4255-9896-5c67c33ee2a4.description: Earners of the Applying Behavioural Science to Create Change Micro-Credential have developed an understanding of the factors that define and influence human behaviour, and the theories, tools, and methods used by behavioural scientists to tackle key global and local behavioural challenges. They are proficient in applying behavioural science concepts and skills, to understand, explore, and address behaviour change challenges from topics such as health, community, and sustainability.
9a273ba3-5092-4255-9896-5c67c33ee2a4.name: Applying Behavioural Science to Create Change

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate active course participation and content engagement by responding to ten modular discussion forum activities throughout the course. This task requires a reflection on learning in each module, and the application of this learning to a scenario to demonstrate understanding and skill application. This is also an opportunity to contribute to the collaborative learning environment.

Successfully complete the assessment ‘Policy Brief’; a 1000-word brief that critically analyses the opportunities to change people’s behaviour with regard to a sustainability issue. The writing must be structured as a response to a specific audience, and recommendations around programs or policies to engage people and change their behaviour with regard to the issue need to be made.

Successfully complete the assessment ‘Briefing Document’; a 1000-word document describing a current sustainability challenge from a behavioural perspective, including stakeholder and influence mapping, behaviour identification and prioritisation.

Successfully complete the assessment ‘Intervention Proposal’; a 1000-word proposal for a behaviour change solution to the sustainability challenge based on what is known about the problem, the priority behaviour and the target audience. This must also include a framework to measure the impact of the proposed intervention.

c7186e16-2f09-4eeb-a437-e4561c0b57ec.description: Earners of the Applying Behavioural Science to Create Change professional development course have developed an understanding of factors that define and influence human behaviour, and the theories, tools, and methods used by behavioural scientists to tackle key global and local behavioural challenges. They are proficient in applying behavioural science concepts and skills, to understand, explore, and address behaviour change challenges from topics such as health, community, and sustainability.
c7186e16-2f09-4eeb-a437-e4561c0b57ec.name: Applying Behavioural Science to Create Change

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate active course participation and content engagement by responding to ten modular discussion forum activities throughout the course. This task requires a reflection on learning in each module, and the application of this learning to a scenario to demonstrate understanding and skill application. This is also an opportunity to contribute to the collaborative learning environment.

ffcee041-55c1-42d4-9da5-8c4cb48d41f1.description: Earners of the FinTech Boot Camp have experience with a host of popular tools and methods such as Python programming, financial libraries, machine learning algorithms, solidity smart contracts, Ethereum, and blockchain. They have learned how these concepts are leveraged within financial fields as well as best practices for using these skills to add value to an organisation. They are competent in financial programming, machine learning applications in finance, and blockchain and cryptocurrency.
ffcee041-55c1-42d4-9da5-8c4cb48d41f1.name: FinTech

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the project for 'Financial Programming with Python'. This requires the use of Pandas to clean and format your dataset(s), the creation of a Jupyter Notebook describing the data exploration and cleanup process, creating a Jupyter Notebook illustrating the final data analysis, using PyViz, Panel, Plotly Express, and Hvplot to create six to eight visualisations of the data, and then aggregate these visualisations into a dashboard and using one new Python library.

Complete the project for 'Machine Learning for Finance'. This requires creating a Jupyter Notebook, Google Colab Notebook, or Amazon SageMake, Notebook to prepare a training and testing dataset,  apply a dimensionality reduction technique to reduce the input features, or perform feature engineering to generate new features to train the model, create one or more machine learning models, fit the models to the training data, evaluate the trained models using testing data.

Complete the project for ‘Blockchain and Cryptocurrencies’. This requires tokenise an asset using the proper ERC standards, create a decentralised auction in Solidity, build a digital marketplace powered by smart contracts, create an automated algorithmic trading system, design an in-depth dashboard for investors to quickly visualise their portfolios and use machine learning and NLP to predict trends in stock prices.

7aec462c-6b70-4463-9ad3-7bef9cd13915.description: Earners of the UX/UI Bootcamp badge have experience with a host of popular tools and methods such as Adobe XD, Figma, InVision, agile methodology, user centered design research, and rapid prototyping. Earners know how these concepts are leveraged within design fields from UX research to UI development, as well as best practices for using these skills. They are skilled in fundamental programming, data analysis, and modern tools in cryptocurrency and blockchain.
7aec462c-6b70-4463-9ad3-7bef9cd13915.name: UX/UI

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the mobile app design challenge. This project requires earners to present a project using a clickable prototype and UX case study.
Complete a non-profit website redesign. This requires earners to present a project using high-fidelity prototypes and a case study.

Complete the Open Design project. This requires earners to combine the processes and technologies they’ve learned throughout the course to conceptualise and create a HTML/CSS website prototype powered by design thinking that solves human-centered needs.

skills.name: Continuity And Branding In UX And UI

59e689bd-773b-4cdc-a3c2-ab77f4e1f9e6.description: Earners of the Civics and Citizenship Professional Learning Program have undertaken a short course that aims to enhance teacher capacity to implement the Victorian Curriculum Civics and Citizenship Levels 3–10 with special attention to the development of political, legal and sociological pedagogical content knowledge in the curriculum. They have enhanced capacity in implementing and teaching the Victorian Curriculum Civics and Citizenship Levels 3–10.
59e689bd-773b-4cdc-a3c2-ab77f4e1f9e6.name: Civics and Citizenship Professional Learning Program

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the quizzes. This requires the completion of set quizzes relating to content knowledge in the Victorian Curriculum Civics and Citizenship Levels 3–10.

Submit a learning and teaching plan. This requires the submission of a learning and teaching plan at the conclusion of the program which incorporates content, pedagogy and application of the Victorian Curriculum Civics and Citizenship Levels 3–10.

2527389c-6114-4e95-85a3-98716bb6717b.description: Earners of the Data Science: Data-Driven Decision Making micro-credential have developed the entry-level skills needed to develop data visualisations through R programming in order to understand and communicate messages from data. They are competent with data wrangling and workflows, modelling and visualising data, and have the ability to communicate the story of their data.
2527389c-6114-4e95-85a3-98716bb6717b.name: Data Science: Data-Driven Decision Making

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Data Science: Data-Driven Decision Making micro-credential courses. This requires completion of the three courses, Wrangling and Workflow, Modelling and Visualisation, and Formats, Ethics, and Storytelling.

Pass the assignment 'R Markdown report'. This assignment requires reading and cleaning a 'wild' dataset, then from this dataset to produce visual summaries, apply modelling strategies to answer questions, and then describe, diagnose and explain the workflows for this modelling.

Pass the assignment 'Your story dashboard'. This assignment requires building on the R Markdown report assessment to create an interactive dashboard using RStudio's flexdashboard package. The dashboard includes two inputs that dashboard users can modify to update results of an analysis, one interactive plot, and one user interface element that allows a dashboard user to make predictions from a model.

551d6f91-1b8e-4ae7-be2c-962fc9b8e2a7.description: Earners of the Women in Technology Mentoring Program credential have supported current women IT students through a mentoring program to develop confidence and help them recognise and plan personal and professional goals. They are skilled in mentoring, active listening and have the ability to assist others in identifying career goals.
551d6f91-1b8e-4ae7-be2c-962fc9b8e2a7.name: Women in Technology Mentoring Program

badge_template_activities.title: Be a mentor in the mentoring program. This involves meeting with a mentee 1:1, discussing the mentee’s career aims and providing them with direct feedback and suggestions on career pathways.
Attend a commencement session with a professional coach. This requires attending a session to learn skills in mentoring such as active listening, relationship structure and establishing boundaries.

Attend a brainstorming session. This requires attending a mid program session with program managers to provide feedback and assist in the development of new initiatives for the program. This session provides mentors with an opportunity to practice problem solving skills and contribute to the design of the program.

65d403a2-032d-442f-8aaf-40c2447b25cb.description: Recipients of the Alumni Mentoring Network badge are verified members of the Monash alumni community and have participated as a mentee, mentor or both in 2022.
65d403a2-032d-442f-8aaf-40c2447b25cb.name: Alumni Mentoring Network 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in the Monash Alumni Mentoring network in 2022. This requires Monash alumni status and meetings completed via the mentoring platform.

40086788-1031-419f-9010-e49055e75da2.description: Earners of the Technology for Education in Clinical Healthcare (EdTech) professional development course have gained skills in implementing current and emerging technologies to enhance their teaching and learner engagement. They are proficient in designing and developing online educational programs and digital learning resources, and applying learning science and educational design principles to their teaching.
40086788-1031-419f-9010-e49055e75da2.name: Technology for Education in Clinical Healthcare (EdTech)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Technology for Education in Clinical Healthcare (EdTech) professional development course. This requires active engagement in eight modules: instructional design, developing visual media, technology for assessment, interactivity, cognition and learning, video production, enhancing engagement and synchronous learning, and social media.

f6aadc0f-a959-4a4f-a83e-62b4ce0d465a.description: Earners of the Grid Integration and GPS Studies of Renewables Professional Development have expertise in the modelling and control of power electronic converters, the grid integration of renewable energy resources. They are also competent in applying national electricity rules for generator performance standards studies for renewable energy resources. Additionally, they are familiar with Dynamic Model Acceptance Tests (DMAT) of the Australian Energy Market Operator.
f6aadc0f-a959-4a4f-a83e-62b4ce0d465a.name: Grid Integration and GPS Studies of Renewables

badge_template_activities.title: Attend the lecture sessions on the control and modelling of power electronic converters followed by lectures on GPS studies and DMAT tests for renewable energy resources. These lectures enable the attendees to understand and analyse various concepts around the grid integration of renewable energy resources.
Attend the simulation sessions and complete the tasks assigned for each concept covered in the lectures.

2cfde68a-30a6-4161-a4aa-15a8015a40ab.description: Earners of the Technology for Education in Clinical Healthcare (EdTech) micro-credential have gained skills in implementing current and emerging technologies to enhance their teaching and learner engagement. They are proficient in designing and developing online educational programs and digital learning resources, and applying learning science and educational design principles to their teaching.
2cfde68a-30a6-4161-a4aa-15a8015a40ab.name: Technology for Education in Clinical Healthcare (EdTech)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Technology for Education in Clinical Healthcare (EdTech) micro-credential course. This requires active engagement in eight modules:  instructional design, developing visual media, technology for assessment, interactivity, cognition and learning, video production, enhancing engagement and synchronous learning, and social media.

Pass the assessment ‘Digital learning intervention lesson plan’. This assessment requires the development of a technology-rich learning intervention, delivered as both a written lesson plan and video presentation. The lesson plan clearly describes strategies, resources, educational frameworks, and assessments aligned with lesson goals and learning objectives.

Pass the assessment ‘Educational software analysis’. This assessment requires the evaluation of a software program or application that can enhance teaching in the health professions, using the critical application of educational theories, frameworks, and principles of learning. The software is analysed in terms of its potential to engage learners and teachers, enable self-directed and/or collaborative learning, enhance long-term retention, and use in formative and/or summative assessment.

Pass the assessment ‘Analytical paper’. This assessment requires the production of an analytical paper on the use of technology to enhance learning in the health professions. It requires a critical, well referenced discussion of the potential or actual impact of a chosen topic on the educational experience of a participant as either teacher or learner/trainee.

14505915-5d33-4c7d-939e-6cf7d5ec933e.description: Earners of the Grid Forming Inverters Professional Development short course have developed a detailed understanding in fundamentals of grid forming inverters, their modelling, and different control topologies. They have gained competence in grid capabilities, PSCAD applications, and dynamic performance interpretation of grid forming inverters under various grid conditions.
14505915-5d33-4c7d-939e-6cf7d5ec933e.name: Grid Forming Inverters

badge_template_activities.title: Attend the theory sessions. This requires participants to actively listen to the concepts explained and follow along the course material provided.
Attend the practical sessions. This requires participants to attempt and complete the practical PSCAD tasks according to the instructions provided.

This requires participants to actively engage with the teaching team during the theory sessions to ensure/confirm they have a clear understanding, and engage with demonstrators during practical sessions to seek guidance on tasks (where required) or verification on the obtained results.

499790b8-1086-4091-8f22-c139291624bd.description: Earners of the Clear Leadership course badge have developed three interrelated skill sets: the skills required to sustain partnership and collaboration, the skills required for leading learning in the midst of performing, and the skills of self differentiation. Earners are competent conducting Organisational Learning Conversations, and they coach, mediate and use leadership communication skills to create organisational learning.
499790b8-1086-4091-8f22-c139291624bd.name: Clear Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in nine live experience sessions over four weeks. These sessions cover raising self-awareness, enhancing workplace relationships by developing skills to lead conversations that increase effectiveness and collaboration in the workplace.

Participate in self-directed learning activities. Self-directed learning activities require reading and preparing for action learning and then applying this to their professional practice through learning conversations.

Participate in learning via a peer partnership, focusing on  issues pertinent to their own leadership challenge. This requires partnering with a peer to support action learning, then practising skills in learning conversations.
Coach two other people through a Learning Conversation guided by instructions provided by the course facilitator. This requires using a learning conversation framework.

0a693064-94b8-40bc-98d8-88faa904f6a1.description: Earners of the Digital Marketing Boot Camp certification have demonstrated proficiency in fundamental digital marketing concepts through use of Google Keyword Planner, Google Ads (for search and display campaigns), Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn Ads Managers and Wordpress. They have displayed their ability to create marketing plans, generate and nurture leads, create content, run retargeting campaigns, and enhance a website for search engine optimisation.
0a693064-94b8-40bc-98d8-88faa904f6a1.name: Digital Marketing

badge_template_activities.title: Work in a project team to complete a marketing plan and then plot and build a website from the ground up. This project requires a demonstrated understanding of how websites help businesses reach their goals and serve as home base for marketing efforts.

Using the marketing skills acquired throughout the course, work in a project team to create a promotional marketing plan. This task tests digital ad design, search engine and display marketing, social media marketing and marketing automation.

8d5cf058-87d6-4b66-a9ec-40b2879a499a.description: Earners of the Using Research Well in Practice course have skills in identifying and evaluating different types of research evidence; discussing and adapting research with colleagues; and integrating professional expertise with research to improve specific areas of practice. This 20 hour program has been designed to meet AITSL Australian Professional Standards for Teachers 6.2: Engage in professional learning and improve practice and 6.3: Engage with colleagues and improve practice.
8d5cf058-87d6-4b66-a9ec-40b2879a499a.name: Using Research Well in Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Attend course webinars in order for participants to develop their knowledge, skills, and confidence in using research evidence as part of school-based practice and improvement.
Complete online Modules which includes watching videos, answering questions, reading and reflecting, contributing to forums and completing quizzes
Develop a project plan which outlines the implementation of a research-based intervention in a school or organisation

433a2e86-9460-4f0b-b167-911868512c45.description: Earners of this badge have developed skills and knowledge to understand complicated and complex working environments, how to lead in each and make purposeful choices that will support sustained success. They understand what innovation means in modern business and the factors that contribute to an innovation culture. They understand the latest neuroscience behind mental well-being, identify limiting mindsets and practice reframing techniques and actionable microsteps that build resilience.
433a2e86-9460-4f0b-b167-911868512c45.name: GPC Asia-Pacific Executive Leadership Program

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of four executive level modules (online and face-to-face) over 8 months, comprising Module 1 Fostering Trust and Collaboration at GPC, Module 2 Building a Culture of Innovation, Module 3 Bedding In the Strategy Behaviourally, and Module 4 Navigating Complexity.
Participation in in self-directed and group learning activities, both of which require reading and preparation for active learning and then applying this to their professional practice.

fccaabe5-4e6d-4efa-85ba-229f1c07bf5b.description: Earners of the Executive Presence course badge have developed skills required to enhance their effectiveness as a leader through making a positive impression, backing themselves and influencing others. They are competent at building and leading teams, signalling their expertise and communicating powerfully.
fccaabe5-4e6d-4efa-85ba-229f1c07bf5b.name: Executive Presence

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in live experience sessions over six weeks. These sessions cover strengthening and cultivating self leadership, decoding executive presence, exploring stress and how to achieve peak performance, understanding energy transfer amongst teams, and delivering and receiving feedback.

Participate in three individual executive coaching sessions. These personalised sessions are with a qualified Executive Coach and focus on learning transfer and embedding positive new habits into professional life.
Participate in social learning through three Peer Pod sessions. Collaborate with peers on an active learning project, practice reflective dialogue and expand your professional network.

fec0665c-4518-48bb-b015-1f5f35c5dcb2.description: Earners of the Harnessing the Potential of Cultural Diversity in the Workplace course have developed a range of strategies to tap into the diverse cultural knowledge of a workplace. They are skilled at providing opportunities for teams to safely talk about their cultural identity and values, able to understand their own mindsets and unconscious biases and how these impact communication and business outcomes, and possess tools and strategies to develop their own intercultural competence.
fec0665c-4518-48bb-b015-1f5f35c5dcb2.name: Harnessing the Potential of Cultural Diversity in the Workplace

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Harnessing the Potential of Cultural Diversity in the Workplace professional development course. This course requires active participation in workshops, attendance at lunchtime learning sessions and engagement with online learning materials.

6843b867-2cfe-4517-aa25-c2c633a4aa2e.description: Earners of the Digital Health in Low Resource Settings professional development digital credential have developed the skills to design and implement digital health tools in low resource settings. They are competent at critically analysing existing digital health approaches for digital health tools, evaluating whether a digital health tool is producing the intended outputs, and explaining common digital health implementation considerations (such as legal frameworks, interoperability, and ethics)
6843b867-2cfe-4517-aa25-c2c633a4aa2e.name: Digital Health in Low Resource Settings

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all the modules in the Digital Health in Low Resource Settings course on OpenLearning. This requires completion of modules in all four weeks, including the weekly assessments.

Complete the week 1 assessment task. This requires joining a study group to critically assess a digital health technology. To successfully complete this assessment, learners must identify two commercially available digital health technologies, select a low resource setting, and discuss how the selected digital health tools would work in the setting.

Complete the week 2 assessment task. This requires joining a study group to develop a plan for a 60 minute online design workshop for the given scenario. To successfully complete this assessment, learners must do some initial research on the given scenario, develop the plan, use the provided template to map the design activity and sessions, and upload the design workshop according to the instructions given.

Complete the week 3 assessment task. This requires joining a study group to develop an Expression of Interest response to a digital health grant. To successfully complete this assessment, learners must review the grant details, develop an EOI response, and upload the collated response according to the instructions given.

Complete the week 4 assessment task. This requires learners to individually reflect on legal and ethical challenges for digital health tools. To successfully complete this assessment, learners must read the given paper, write a 500-word reflection of the ethical and legal challenges within, and submit the reflection according to the instructions given.

e495c520-d93f-4887-8bdb-20cbeed7f498.description: Earners of the Digital Strategy and Transformation course have developed the skills to undertake a digital transformation in their organisation. Digital Strategy and Transformation course earners have critically analysed global digital shifts, and understand the importance of engaging customers and staff in creating a digital transformation roadmap. They are competent in articulating a digital experience vision, engaging customers and staff and driving an organisational digital change journey.
e495c520-d93f-4887-8bdb-20cbeed7f498.name: Digital Strategy and Transformation

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in four, three hour Live Experiences. These Live Experiences feature activities where participants critically analyse the effect of global digital shifts on their business, building towards a drafted conceptual vision of their digital strategy and creating a digital transformation roadmap.

Participate in four Peer Coaching sessions. In these sessions, critically reflect with peers on key concepts and approaches to digital strategy and change as follows: Week 1 - Exploring bias in technology; Week 2 - Discussion guide feedback; Week 3 - Exploring co-design concepts; Week 4 - Learning from failure.
Participate in periodic reading and discussion sessions. Share ideas and stretch your thinking on key topics, and learn from other perspectives.
Think reflectively about the program. Participants are guided by facilitator questions to explore their own professional practice in the program.

643ff9dd-db8a-4ebb-afd6-188333fb7552.description: Earners of the 'Introduction to Digital Health' course badge have developed fundamental knowledge in the field of digital health. They have developed an understanding of how digital health influences healthcare through innovations, patient safety and health data analytics. They have explored issues relating to digital health, mobile health, e-health, and tele-health and how these can facilitate improved patient care with the rapid development of digital bio-markers.
643ff9dd-db8a-4ebb-afd6-188333fb7552.name: Introduction to Digital Health

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the 6-week ‘Introduction to Digital Health’ course. Badge earners have accessed the course content and participated in online discussions in the course.

5ea1cf51-da35-414f-82f6-08e451267465.description: Unleashing Your Authentic Leadership workshop attendees can describe contemporary approaches to leadership in the context of intensive care medicine, understanding themselves and others as leaders and creators of psychologically safe and compassionate work environments. They leaders proficient in creating psychologically safe work environments, building resilience in themselves and others, and understanding the distinction between who you are as an individual and what you do as a professional.
5ea1cf51-da35-414f-82f6-08e451267465.name: Unleashing Your Authentic Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Attended the workshop. This workshop requires participants to learn contemporary approaches to humanising leadership and to apply these to the intensive care environment in health care through class and case discussions, and an action plan.

cb71235d-6f57-4b8c-9d03-0fa401d5a552.description: Earners of the Designing Behavioural Interventions and Measuring Change short course have gained broad skills in the use of evidence-based tools and methods to design, develop, and evaluate behaviour change interventions. They are competent in applying research evidence and audience insights to diagnose behaviour, models and frameworks to prioritise interventions, and research methods to evaluate impact.
cb71235d-6f57-4b8c-9d03-0fa401d5a552.name: Designing Behavioural Interventions and Measuring Change

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated active course participation and content engagement by responding to 9 modular discussion forum activities throughout the course. This task requires a reflection on learning in each module, or the application of this learning to a scenario to demonstrate understanding and skill application. This is also an opportunity to collaboratively contribute to group learning.

ceddfdbf-77bb-41de-bbad-a28f2e8db42d.description: Earners of the Harnessing Behavioural Insights short course have developed an understanding of the factors that define and influence human behaviour, and the theories, tools, and methods used by behavioural scientists to tackle key global and local behavioural challenges. They are proficient in applying behavioural science concepts and skills, to understand, explore, and address behaviour change challenges from topics such as health, community, and sustainability.
ceddfdbf-77bb-41de-bbad-a28f2e8db42d.name: Harnessing Behavioural Insights

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate active course participation and content engagement by responding to ten modular discussion forum activities throughout the course. This task requires a reflection on learning in each module, and the application of this learning to a scenario to demonstrate understanding and skill application. This is also an opportunity to contribute to the collaborative learning environment.

0207c552-3b8c-4f24-91f1-f4898aa229a7.description: Earners of the Leading Your Organisation to Transform badge have gained the knowledge and skills that will enable them to diagnose transformational challenges and lead their organisation to adapt to transformational change. They understand how to build and implement a transformation agenda and have the skills to lead and inspire others to achieve these transformation goals.
0207c552-3b8c-4f24-91f1-f4898aa229a7.name: Leading Your Organisation To Transform

badge_template_activities.title: Participation in four 3-hour live experience sessions over four weeks. These sessions cover diagnosing the transformational challenge, exploring adaptive organisations, examining transformational leadership and inspiring transformation.

Participate in weekly peer-learning sessions, focusing on individual transformation challenges. This requires sharing of ideas through self-managed meetings, exploring peers' transformational challenges and leveraging the Step-back Consulting question model.

Participants select a transformation challenge to work on over the four-week program. This requires unpacking an organisational transformation agenda, identifying complexities to the challenge, identifying gaps in the diagnostic process and working with peers in peer pod meetings to guide potential actions.

Participate in weekly reading and discussion sessions. This requires applying theoretical concepts to answer questions, and then describing, diagnosing and explaining in their own professional practice context.
Participate in self-directed learning activities. These require reading and reflection on questions and their own professional practice each week.

f895cc29-adbc-4b0b-a9a6-e30d70b217cc.description: Earners of the 'Foundations of Design Thinking' short course have attained competency in the Design Thinking process, enabling them to apply the process to finding appropriate, user-focused, responses to complex issues and challenges. They are competent in applying the Design Thinking strategies of discovery, define, design and demonstrate to interrogate an issue, identify end-user needs, explore idea generation and create prototype responses.
f895cc29-adbc-4b0b-a9a6-e30d70b217cc.name: Foundations of Design Thinking

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the application of the design thinking process to defining a complex problem. This task requires identifying a complex issue to interrogate, pitching their potential project to other participants in the course, and forming a team to work on the issue.

Build an end-user profile using the empathy mapping, journey mapping and stakeholder mapping templates. Completion of this activity requires qualitative and quantitative research, collaboration, critical thinking and skills of discernment.

Generate multiple potential responses to the challenge, organising these responses thematically, and then extracting from these diverse responses the most desirable, sustainable, feasible and viable solution.
Create a prototype and test responses using storyboarding tools and seeking constructive feedback from peers and the course facilitator.

624115b1-e167-41a1-915c-f88d388f2f26.description: The Rail Welding – Fundamentals to Frontiers digital credential is delivered by the Monash Institute of Railway Technology. Earners of this digital credential have developed an understanding of the two main rail joining processes of flash butt and aluminothermic welding. They understand the welding process steps, key parameters, factors to resolve issues, and the interpretation and application of the AS1085.20 standard.
624115b1-e167-41a1-915c-f88d388f2f26.name: Rail Welding – Fundamentals to Frontiers

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Rail Welding – Fundamentals to Frontiers three day course, delivered by the Monash Institute of Railway Technology. This requires completion of topics such as welding types, key parameters, standards and issue fault finding.
Attend the practical welding demonstrations with the Monash Institute of Railway Technology to understand the mechanics of welds, their setup and quality control measures.

e6a522ef-de52-47d5-abec-124fcb7fb8e1.description: Earners of the Transforming Retail Food Environments to be Health-Enabling short course have attained knowledge and skills needed to develop evidence-informed health-enabling strategies with the food retail sector for improved population health. They are knowledgeable of effective interventions for health-enabling food retail environments, and of how to implement and evaluate interventions and assess the healthiness of food retail environments.
e6a522ef-de52-47d5-abec-124fcb7fb8e1.name: Transforming Retail Food Environments to be Health-Enabling

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Transforming food retail environments to be health-enabling short course. This requires completion of the 9 topic quizzes, contribution to discussion boards and viewing of the 9 on-line class events.

skills.name: Effective Engagement And Co-design With Food Retail Sector

8d3f737e-a2b9-4c14-bcb5-f4e49d006e9f.description: Earners of the Culturally Diverse Women program badge have applied a career planning, goal setting and management methodology to progress their career goals whilst navigating barriers and biases, owing to gender, race, culture, age and other intersections of diversity. They are skilled in connecting their cultural identity into their personal brand and articulating it as a benefit into value proposition at work; goal setting and goal progress in their roles and career aspirations; and strategica
8d3f737e-a2b9-4c14-bcb5-f4e49d006e9f.name: Culturally Diverse Women

badge_template_activities.title: Participation in four masterclasses and a workshop. These are: Masterclass 1: Leveraging your cultural heritage, Masterclass 2: Goal setting, Masterclass 3: Develop your online and offline brand, Allies and advocates workshop, Masterclass 4: Creating advocacy inside your organisation.

Accountability partners participants in the program function as peer to peer support for another participant/s. Participants self-organize to form these relationships or they are steered and supported by the facilitator. This helps the group to bond as a community of practice. The main function of the accountability partners is to follow up and accountability check with their person/group about their ‘commitments to act’made in the previous session - this serves as an input into the next session

Allies and advocates : Allies and advocates are chosen by each participant once they have set a career goal or aspiration. Participants strategically select an ally and advocate [can be more than 2 people] who is connected to their goal, to invite to Allies and Advocates workshop and to the last session of the program. The main aim of selected allies and advocates per participant, is to ensure continuity in their progress [long after the program has closed], to build capability with allies and a

e77017f1-7dc9-4a3a-a016-677f1f86744d.description: Earners of the Gender-Sensitive Training for Inclusive Placemaking Micro-credential have developed a foundational understanding of gender-sensitive issues and some tools to advocate. Participants have an understanding of the social issues faced by women and gender-diverse people, and how these impact the creation of, maintenance and re-design of public spaces. And, consequently how the application of evidence-based research can create safer and more inclusive public spaces.
e77017f1-7dc9-4a3a-a016-677f1f86744d.name: Gender-Sensitive Training for Inclusive Placemaking

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the course materials. This micro-credential course requires completion of six modules: Introduction And Key Concepts for Gender-Sensitive Placemaking, Understanding Gender, Safety and Urban Placemaking, Questioning the Idea of a Generic User in Placemaking, Applying Gender-Sensitive Placemaking Lens and Identifying Strategies One and Two, and Advocating for Gender-Sensitive Placemaking.

Pass Assessment One. This assessment requires the production of a folio that documents the weekly thematics, activities and reflections undertaken and clearly communicates the processes of exploration, evidence-based research, gender-sensitive placemaking strategies, and design-thinking skills.

Pass Assessment Two. This assessment requires the completion of two components: the recording of a short presentation that critically explores the process and application of gender-sensitive placemaking strategies; and a strategic advocacy statement championing gender-sensitive placemaking agendas in professional practice. This involves investigating identifying issues and opportunities to implement evidence-based knowledge of gender-sensitive placemaking within the public sector.

a9ba74f9-78da-47e7-b18e-265edf6688e8.description: Earners of the Advanced Malaysian Anti-Corruption and Integrity certification program have demonstrated their ability to audit anti-bribery and corruption compliance within their organisations in line with Malaysia’s anti-corruption law and are able to implement steps to mitigate any potential bribery and corruption areas identified within their organisation. They are skilled in analysing their organisation’s anti-bribery readiness, mitigate risks, and brief others on practical applications.
a9ba74f9-78da-47e7-b18e-265edf6688e8.name: Anti-Corruption Compliance

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in face-to-face or video conferencing sessions. Participants have attended a total of 10.5 hours of face-to-face or video conferencing sessions, split into 4 sessions of 2 to 2.5 hours each.
Complete the twelve modules of the course. Badge earners have accessed these modules on a dedicated online learning management platform on anti-corruption, then completed the modules on the system.
Complete the self-assessment on anti-corruption. Participants identify their organisation’s anti-corruption risk profile through a self-assessed system.

Complete the essay on an anti-corruption related scenario. After completing their learning modules, participants are provided with two scenarios and then must submit a 2000 word essay on their chosen anti-corruption related scenario .

skills.name: Practical Application Of Law Into Business Practices

1db51577-8a16-49c0-b4c8-5fa0fa113191.description: Earners of the Harnessing Behavioural Insights micro-credential have developed an understanding of the factors that define and influence human behaviour, and the theories, tools, and methods used by behavioural scientists to tackle key global and local behavioural challenges. They are proficient in applying behavioural science concepts and skills, to understand, explore, and address behaviour change challenges from topics such as health, community, and sustainability.
1db51577-8a16-49c0-b4c8-5fa0fa113191.name: Harnessing Behavioural Insights

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate active course participation and content engagement by responding to ten modular discussion forum activities throughout the course. This task requires a reflection on learning in each module, and the application of this learning to a scenario to demonstrate understanding and skill application. This is also an opportunity to contribute to the collaborative learning environment.

Successfully complete the assessment ‘Policy Brief’; a 1000-word brief that critically analyses the opportunities to change people’s behaviour with regard to a public policy issue. The writing must be structured as a response to a specific audience, and recommendations around programs or policies to engage people and change their behaviour with regard to the issue need to be made.

Successfully complete the assessment ‘Briefing Document’; a 1000-word document describing a current public policy challenge from a behavioural perspective, including stakeholder and influence mapping, behaviour identification and prioritisation.

Successfully complete the assessment ‘Intervention Proposal’; a 1000-word proposal for a behaviour change solution to the public policy challenge based on what is known about the problem, the priority behaviour and the target audience. This must also include a framework to measure the impact of the proposed intervention.

ecc56bec-cd8c-495f-9700-89f5f770784b.description: Earners of this badge have developed a fundamental understanding of current global regulatory developments on modern slavery. This includes Australia’s Moden Slavery Act 2018 and how to best respond to the reporting criteria under the Act using Monash University’s Modern Slavery Disclosure (MSD) framework to benchmark and enhance organisational reporting capabilities.
ecc56bec-cd8c-495f-9700-89f5f770784b.name: Modern Slavery Reporting

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a 1.5 day workshop that will focus current global regulatory developments on modern slavery, mandatory reporting requirements of Australia’s Modern Slavery Act 2018 and guidance, how best to respond to these using Monash University’s Modern Slavery Disclosure scoring framework and how to improve their organisational reporting capabilities.

34dbf09b-8faf-4bbd-9bd4-99676c9aee54.description: Earners of the Sustainable Healthcare in Practice Professional Development Course have developed skills and knowledge to influence the healthcare sector’s transition to more sustainable practice. They have gained skills and knowledge in: analysing linkages between climate change, health equity and healthcare; planetary health principles; applying systems thinking and behavioural insights; net zero carbon healthcare and the circular economy; and influencing for sustainable healthcare outcomes.
34dbf09b-8faf-4bbd-9bd4-99676c9aee54.name: Sustainable Healthcare in Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of all short quizzes across all modules 1-6 with a minimum pass rate of 50%.
Completion of all short discussions across modules 1 – 7.

7bd42e2b-d7b1-4e5f-b6b6-d038ae615894.description: Earners of the Climate Change and Business Risk badge will be able to apply frameworks for transitioning to net zero emissions; assess what a robust and ambitious climate strategy looks like; characterise climate-related physical, transition and legal risks and articulate the changing expectations of investors, regulators and customers and the role of disclosure.
7bd42e2b-d7b1-4e5f-b6b6-d038ae615894.name: Climate Change and Business Risk

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a 2-day workshop that will teach participants how to move past short-term pressures, policy uncertainty, and the difficulty of organisational and systems change, to develop a strategic approach for successfully integrating climate into strategy.

f94a736e-50c0-4131-b114-9b9c51d5dfb5.description: Earners of the Evolving Health Leadership short course have developed the skills needed to operate as health leaders in a rapidly transforming sector. They are competent in: translating key trends in health leadership to their health organisation; fostering greater leadership alignment across different organisational layers; and applying insights from neuroscience and behavioural science to individual and team decision-making, interactions and environments.
f94a736e-50c0-4131-b114-9b9c51d5dfb5.name: Evolving Health Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Evolving Health Leadership course. This course required participants to attend weekly live sessions, engage with neuroscience, behavioural science and social science based content, actively engage in weekly peer group sessions as well as interact through the learning management system using hub discussion boards and online activities including quizzes, reflections and readings.

26749fd4-2546-448c-992a-b6540aaafd15.description: Earners of the Leading Complexity course are able to distinguish between simple, complicated and complex environments and apply appropriate leadership approaches to each accurately assess the depth. They can accurately assess the breadth and dynamism of their networks and to build greater network advantage. Earners understand the critical elements of and take steps to create psychological safety, and are able to influence organisational culture, with an emphasis on collaboration and inclusion.
26749fd4-2546-448c-992a-b6540aaafd15.name: Leading Complexity

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in four 3-hour Live Experiences. Earners have participated in weekly Live Experiences, providing skills and experience in leading adaptively, leading systems, leading safely, and leading culture. This has provided earners will skills and experience in applying their leadership in complex operating environment, assessing the characteristics of professional networks, and reflecting on how to consciously shape culture to create psychologically-safe workplaces.
Apply skills to an adaptive workplace challenge. This requires participants to select, present, collaborate and support peer learning on a workplace challenge.

Participate in two 2-hour Peer Coaching sessions. This requires earners to present their adaptive leadership challenge to their allocated peer group. Using peer group coaching, earners support the peer workplace challenge to progress. Earners reflect on the process and their participation in it using reflective questions.

Participate in four guided self-reflections and a program reflection. Earners reflect and respond to facilitator questions mapped to weekly content, and then apply leadership modelling to their own workplace. Earners reflect on their views of leadership and their own leadership growth during the program.

fcc4d691-0009-443d-9d7f-ed880637f545.description: Earners of the Advanced Employee and Industrial Relations Compliance certification program have demonstrated their ability to apply the law’s requirements of fairness and documentation when managing employees, demonstrate practical knowledge on how to ensure their organisations’ HR related processes and policies, nurture an environment where employees are motivated to perform to their best potential, and apply skills on how to engage their subordinates when managing their daily tasks.
fcc4d691-0009-443d-9d7f-ed880637f545.name: Industrial Relations

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in face-to-face or video conferencing sessions. Participants have attended a total of 14 hours of face-to-face or video conferencing sessions, split into 6 sessions of 2 to 2.5 hours each.

Complete the twenty-nine modules of the course. Badge earners have accessed these modules on a dedicated online learning management platform on employee and industrial relations, then completed the modules on the system.

Complete the essay on employee/industrial relations scenario. After completing their learning modules, participants are provided with two scenarios and then must submit a 2200 word essay on their chosen employee/industrial relations related scenario.

skills.name: Strategically Advance And Protect The Company’s Position

b808e8cc-9232-4147-a8a5-18a2a39f0633.description: Earners of the 'Introduction to Digital Health' micro-credential badge have developed fundamental knowledge in the field of digital health. They have developed an understanding of how digital health influences healthcare through innovations, patient safety and health data analytics. They have explored issues relating to digital health, mobile health, e-health, and tele-health and how these can facilitate improved patient care with the rapid development of digital bio-markers.
b808e8cc-9232-4147-a8a5-18a2a39f0633.name: Introduction to Digital Health

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the 6-week 'Introduction to Digital Health' course.
Complete a 30 minute quiz evaluating knowledge in key concepts relating to digital health.

Complete a reflective essay. This assessment requires participants to demonstrate their understanding of relevant theories, models and frameworks and to think critically as they review, analyse, consolidate and evaluate information and findings from a literature review related to technology use and information management in healthcare.
Complete a case study. This assessment requires participants to conduct a case study on an emerging digital health technology, and its potential impact on healthcare.

13c4db7d-91f3-4110-9545-07a9304259de.description: Earners of the Evolving Health Leadership micro-credential have developed the skills needed to operate as health leaders in a rapidly transforming sector. They are competent in: translating key trends in health leadership to their health organisation; fostering greater leadership alignment across different organisational layers; and applying insights from neuroscience and behavioural science to individual and team decision-making, interactions and environments.
13c4db7d-91f3-4110-9545-07a9304259de.name: Evolving Health Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Evolving Health Leadership course. This course required participants to attend weekly live sessions, engage with neuroscience, behavioural science and social science based content, actively engage in weekly peer group sessions as well as interact through the learning management system using hub discussion boards and online activities including quizzes, reflections and readings.

Pass the assignment ‘Organisational Analysis’. This assignment requires the analysis and summary of how key trends are likely to influence your organisation and the key shifts you’d recommend as areas of focus by 2030. This assignment is required in one of the two submission formats: A written response between 1400 to 1600 words; a video response between 5-7 minutes.
Pass the assignment ‘Team dashboard and action plan’. This assignment requires demonstration of the application of core models introduced during the course to the individual’s own team.
Completion of the reflective journal. This assessment requires the completion and submission of weekly reflective journals.

cfd6f486-1ad1-4221-a7f2-423c25661949.description: Earners of the Sustainable Healthcare in Practice Micro-credential have developed skills to influence the healthcare sector’s transition to more sustainable practice. They have gained skills and knowledge to: develop a sustainable healthcare proposal; analyse links between climate change, health equity & healthcare; planetary health principles; apply systems thinking and behavioural insights; net zero carbon healthcare and the circular economy; and influence for sustainable healthcare outcomes.
cfd6f486-1ad1-4221-a7f2-423c25661949.name: Sustainable Healthcare in Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Sustainable Healthcare in Practice Micro- credential. This requires completion of the seven modules, including two assignments. It requires 6-8 hours weekly of directed learning involving: reviewing course materials, participating in 7 online discussions, completing learning activities, and participation in three 90-minute synchronous webinars. This includes: Completion of quizzes across all modules 1-6 with a minimum pass rate of 50%. Completion of discussions across modules 1-7.

Submit and pass assignment 1 “Assessment Task 1: Design a Policy Brief”. This assignment requires participants to research and develop an 1800-word policy brief articulating the rationale for an inclusive sustainable healthcare approach contextualised for a local setting. A local setting may include, for example, a hospital, allied health clinic, aged care facility, public health district/service, pathology lab, research facility or other.

Submit and pass assignment 2 “Assessment Task 2: Develop a proposal for a sustainable healthcare plan”. This assignment requires participants to research and develop a 2400-word proposal for a sustainable healthcare plan contextualised for a local setting (for example, a hospital, allied health clinic, aged care facility, public health district/service, pathology lab, research facility or other).

136e2a72-a152-48ca-927e-8d49ec070097.description: Earners of the Transforming Retail Food Environments to be Health-Enabling micro-credential have developed skills needed to develop and evaluate evidence-informed health-enabling strategies with the food retail sector for improved population health. They are skilled in identifying effective interventions for health-enabling food retail environments, and in planning for implementation and evaluation of health-enabling interventions.
136e2a72-a152-48ca-927e-8d49ec070097.name: Transforming Retail Food Environments to be Health-Enabling

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Transforming food retail environments to be health-enabling short course. This requires completion of the 9 topic quizzes, contribution to discussion boards and viewing of the 9 on-line class events.

Pass the first assessment. The first of four summative tasks requires the description of a food retail setting and an assessment of its healthiness using a validated assessment tool and consideration of appropriate intervention for improvement.

Pass the second assessment. The second of four summative tasks requires completion of a discussion paper critiquing the evidence on health-enabling food retail, focussing on their chosen food retail setting.
Pass the third assessment. The third of four summative tasks requires the production of a video presenting the chosen food retail case study.
Pass the fourth assessment. The last summative tasks requires a completed report of the chosen food retail case study, with an implementation and evaluation plan.

skills.name: Effective Engagement And Co-design With Food Retail Sector

8a0428ec-e516-4281-bdcb-b2831ebf61de.description: Earners of Design Thinking Now micro-credential have developed the skills and knowledge to apply the Design Thinking approach to respond to complex challenges and issues. They have a foundational understanding of how to create and use appropriate design thinking tools (such as empathy mapping, journey mapping, stakeholder mapping, ideation, prototyping and testing), understand the design thinking mindset, and are able to identify challenges that would benefit from a design thinking approach.
8a0428ec-e516-4281-bdcb-b2831ebf61de.name: Design Thinking Now

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the application of Design Thinking to respond to a complex challenge. This requires the identification of a complex adaptive challenge; interrogation of the challenge; collection of data (through interviews and research) identifying how this challenge impacts on the end-user; ideation - to generate multiple potential responses; and prototyping a response.
During and upon completion of the design thinking process the participant must reflect and evaluate their experience and learning.

skills.name: Analysis of qualitative and quantitative data

f89d2a30-a5cb-47d4-9ded-40dd4a988eba.description: Earners of the Professional Development Design Thinking course have learned the skills and knowledge to apply the Design Thinking approach to respond to complex challenges and issues. They have an understanding of how to create and use appropriate design thinking tools (such as empathy mapping, journey mapping, stakeholder mapping, ideation, prototyping and testing), understand the design thinking mindset, and have learned how to identify challenges that would benefit from a design thinking app
f89d2a30-a5cb-47d4-9ded-40dd4a988eba.name: Design Thinking Now

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the course material. This involves reading all supplied material and completed the tasks of identifying a complex adaptive challenge, as well as responding to feedback from the course facilitator.

skills.name: Analysis of qualitative and quantitative data
